member.summary: Indicates whether the current object is equal to another object of the same type.

member.returns: true if the current object is equal to the other parameter; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object.
member.param: The object to compare with the current object.
member.returns: true if the specified object is equal to the current object; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Serves as the default hash function.

member.name: T:Json.Patch.PatchExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for .

member.name: M:Json.Patch.PatchExtensions.Apply``1(Json.Patch.JsonPatch,``0,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Apply a patch to an object to transform its data.
member.exception: Thrown when the patch cannot be applied.

member.name: M:Json.Patch.PatchExtensions.Apply``2(Json.Patch.JsonPatch,``0,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Apply a patch to an object to transform it to another type.
member.typeparam: The type of the original object.
The type of the target object.
member.exception: Thrown when the patch cannot be applied.

member.summary: Creates a by analyzing the difference between original and target versions.
member.typeparam: The type of the original object.

member.summary: Create JsonPatch from difference between original and target
member.exception: Only Object and Array type json object allowed

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the priority of a member in overload resolution. When unspecified, the default priority is 0.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The priority of the attributed member. Higher numbers are prioritized, lower numbers are deprioritized. 0 is the default if no attribute is present.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute.Priority
member.summary: The priority of the member.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ParamCollectionAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a method will allow a variable number of arguments in its invocation.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WasmImportLinkageAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the P/Invoke marked with this attribute should be linked in as a WASM import.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WasmImportLinkageAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Instance constructor.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.FeatureGuardAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the specified public static boolean get-only property guards access to the specified feature.
member.remarks: Analyzers can use this to prevent warnings on calls to code that is annotated as requiring that feature, when the callsite is guarded by a call to the property.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.FeatureGuardAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified feature type.
member.param: The type that represents the feature guarded by the property.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.FeatureGuardAttribute.FeatureType
member.summary: The type that represents the feature guarded by the property.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.FeatureSwitchDefinitionAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the specified public static boolean get-only property corresponds to the feature switch specified by name.
member.remarks: IL rewriters and compilers can use this to substitute the return value of the specified property with the value of the feature switch.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.FeatureSwitchDefinitionAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified feature switch name.
member.param: The name of the feature switch that provides the value for the specified property.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.FeatureSwitchDefinitionAttribute.SwitchName
member.summary: The name of the feature switch that provides the value for the specified property.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisableUserUnhandledExceptionsAttribute
member.summary: If a .NET Debugger is attached which supports the Debugger.BreakForUserUnhandledException(Exception) API, this attribute will prevent the debugger from breaking on user-unhandled exceptions when the exception is caught by a method with this attribute, unless BreakForUserUnhandledException is called.
